climbs.name: The Snail
climbs.fa: Ian Van Meter & Sam Stuckey- April 9, 2020

content.description:
Climb the handcrack on the left side of the tower to a good ledge. (A great spot to stop and think). Move out left and up the choss arete. Trend right towards worse chose while climbing good moves to the summit. There is zero protection on this route aside from a #2 in the handcrack that will be of no use when pulling chossy moves for the summit.

Descend on a single 1/2 inch bolt in bomber rock on the summit.
content.location: 2 hours from the start of the trailhead on the right.

climbs.name: The Pawn
climbs.fa: Sam Stuckey & Ian Van Meter- May 5, 2020

content.description: This little tower offers chossy rock and subpar beak placements. Climbing starts on the west face. Climb on easy terrain to a ledge, place a cam, *back it up, now beak your way to a mantle for the summit.
content.location: The Pawn is located 40 minutes from the start of the trailhead on the left. 100' to the right of the Bishop.

climbs.name: The Mothership
climbs.fa: Ian Van Meter & Sam Stuckey- April 9, 2020

content.description: Pull free moves to a bolt. C1 to the next bolt, before free climbing below the summit rock. Clip a fixed angle and free the summit. Descend and clean by meat anchor. (No Summit Anchors) The rock quality on the summit was too bad for bolting and there was nothing to sling.
content.location: Located 1 hour and 10 minutes from the start of the trailhead on the left.

climbs.name: The Bishop
climbs.fa: Ian Van Meter & Sam Stuckey- May 5, 2020

content.description:
P1: Start in the back of the obvious chimney on the west face. Navigate a large block at the top to reach the ledge. Build an anchor at the ledge on the backside of the Bishop.

P2: Climb the short .75 crack to face climbing for the summit.
content.location: Located 40 minutes from the start of the trailhead on the left. 100' left of the Pawn.
